9.5.18  6:23 pm   When I record a minor key keyboard solo in a song, I like to play the solo in C minor/C blues and then just transpose up or down as needed. I do this partially because I like the position of the black keys in Cmin (makes for good"slideability"), but also because I just feel more comfortable playing in that key. I feel like I've gotten more used to playing there that I can go to the moon and back easier than in other keys. Do you think I should probably do the smart thing and just get better and more comfortable going wild in all 12 keys, or should I just stick to what's easiest and what I'm best at?
9.5.18  6:22 pm   Do you have a degree in anything?

contract with myself, to make an ongoing series of things

     desperation. kind of like when you are trying to open a cereal box but after 12 hours you still can't get it open but you really really need that cereal, perhaps even more than before so you call the swat team

9.5.18  3:33 pm   when you are writing a new song, how do you keep track of lyrics and form? i know you record all the audio but for like doing run through and building each section do you write anything down, or just listen back to what you played/sang to memorize it? 

     i used to write the chart on staff paper but i no longer use any paper. i use a text file and audio recordings. the lyrics are written in the text, and next to each line (maybe every 2 lines or every 4 lines) there is the file name of the audio reference. when the song is done you might often see a file name at the top of the page for a full run thru. then often when starting the arrangement, i will whip up a "studio chart" (really just chords) based on the run-thru, and put it on paper just to have something on the stand to look at in the empty beginning stages of the arrangement. but pretty soon as things get filled in i wouldn't need it anymore because it's all in there. and then when doing vocals i may type up a lyric cheat sheet. sometimes i may reference the demo run-thru if i want to confirm what the exact melody was

9.5.18  9:19 am   yeh, hey, the new song is really great and makes me feel a special way. i was wondering why la de da isn't on google play?

     when i released that one, google/youtube had just merged their things. i had been avoiding youtube music because i know it releases the song on youtube somewhere, and i wasn't sure if that was going to conflict with my youtube channel some how. so i always avoided youtube music, but then when it merged with google play i had to either avoid both or avoid neither. so for that one i skipped it just to be safe, but for the next song i started including it. Update: just found a way to add stores to already released songs, just added La de da to googleplay/youtube, should be there in a few days

9.5.18  6:57 am   does having successfully reduced video making time make you feel like a huge burden has been taken off your back? you've been struggling with this for a very very long time, and this is a huge success in that regard. can't wait to see the reality video on that, even if it doesn't come out until 2075

     it's exciting because i think it energizes and strengthens the content itself in ways i did not expect. it's very exciting but the problem is, now i have to do the same thing except 3 days shorter because i will be out of town for 3 days. impossible

9.5.18  3:40 am   I wonder why so many people are bothered about you putting an apple on top of fuck.

     i find that words like 'fuck' and 'shit' are so infamous that people clammer to talk about them no matter what. if i don't use them, people wonder why i didn't. if i do use them, people wonder why i did. i thought i could win this time by part way using it but sure enough they still want to talk all about it

9.5.18  3:16 am   What are you worried about?

     ghosts, and ghouls

9.5.18  3:08 am   do you ever talk to yourself because i know i do

9.5.18  3:05 am   Do you consider yourself separate from other things?

     separate from some things, together with others

     Like, that space is what differentiates us from any object? Or perhaps the opposite, in that space is what bridges one thing to th next. That if all things were to stop being considered "things" at all,the concept of these supposed things being separate would fall apart. It would reveal perhaps that everything is part of the same instance of happening in a continuous process of what one might call existence.

     almost any thing is actually just a pattern/configuration, if you really get down to it

9.5.18  2:53 am   do you ever get bored and demotivated while working on long projects like the reality page or the history videos?

     bored, no. panic, yes

9.5.18  2:45 am   Are you in full awareness of the way your audience will react to things,

     no

      because I think you're not the way you act online

9.5.18  1:40 am   How do you manage to focus on only one project at a time without losing motivation or getting pulled away with different ideas? 

     mortality will give you motivation. don't get the wrong idea, i don't have any particularly severe mortality problems (at least i don't think i do) but it starts to become extremely important over time

9.5.18  1:21 am   do you get upset because a lot of people don't take your music seriously because it's so different?

     that sounds like a good sign in general, but one thing that is mildly upsetting is whenever someone asks a question starting with "do you get upset" followed by something that's supposed to sound like it should make me upset. it's like what are they trying to do here
